newsitem.title: UK: Hong Kong stocks in London up after U.S. data.
newsitem.headline: Hong Kong stocks in London up after U.S. data.

text.p: Hong Kong shares firmed in slow London business on Friday, helped by U.S. payroll data and a firm Wall Street start.
The payroll data came in bang in line with expecetations.
Dealers noted limited buying interest in Hong Kong Bank, but added many investor sat on their hands ahead of the U.S. presidential elections.
The Hang Seng London Reference Index was up 57.18 points at 12,586.45 in mid-afternoon trading.
In Hong Kong overnight, the Hang Sang index ended 51.71 points higher at 12,529.27.
